results.title: Enterprise Sales Lead
results.description:
Note: Partly is headquartered in Christchurch (NZ) but has employees across NZ, AU and the EU.

 Our story

Partly's mission is to connect the world's parts and we're doing that by building the first global platform for replacement parts, starting with auto parts. Our big vision is to accelerate the world towards a sustainable future where waste is eliminated and all replacement parts are universally searchable, accessible and available to all.

We've more than tripled our team over the last 12 months and expect to double in size again over the coming 12 months. We're a global team spanning both Europe and Australasia. Founded by ex-Rocket Lab engineers, we utilise bleeding-edge technology to solve challenging but exciting problems that make a huge impact in a $1.9 trillion industry.

We provide a scalable digital infrastructure solution to some of the world's largest businesses and the most exciting startups. Partly's solutions are integrated across hundreds of companies globally, providing the backbone for cataloguing and managing parts online.

Blackbird Ventures (Canva, CultureAmp etc.) led both our Pre-Seed and Seed rounds, alongside I2BF (NYC), Hillfarrance, Icehouse, Peter Beck (Rocket Lab), Akshay Kothari (Notion Co-Founder) and Dylan Field (Figma Co-Founder).

We're continuing to build a world-class team and ensuring Partly is a place where people can do the best work of their lives. We're proud of the culture we've built at Partly, and our values are lived throughout every experience.

 This role

As our Enterprise Sales Lead (EU) you will be a founding hire for our German office and responsible for building out our customer base across Europe. You will be working alongside our Chief Strategy Officer and Senior Account Executive. You are a natural chaser and may have been a high-performing AE or BDE previously. You have a track record of winning new business and are looking for your next big challenge at a fast-growing company where you can quickly start making an impact.

You achieve results by being empathetic and customer-focused. You build long-lasting relationships and are not just a script follower, but an incredible storyteller. You understand the technical details and can create new solutions for your customers' problems that align internally. You also act like an owner to develop and document processes where there are none today and have the discipline to design your day to make yourself most effective.

You will report to Tony Austin (Co-founder and Chief Strategy Officer).

 What will you do
  • Lead and manage our enterprise sales pipeline across a wide range of global and European businesses including, e-commerce Marketplaces, Automotive Manufacturers, Retailers & Distributors
  • Nurture the customer relationship from the first interaction, assess customer needs and pain points, prepare and deliver presentations and demos, follow up with prospects, assemble proposals, negotiate deals and work together with the wider team to convert deals into high-value paying customers.
  • Contact prospective customers by email, LinkedIn, video message or phone (or any other method you feel will help you reach prospects and close deals). You will be approaching prospects with highly targeted and personalised outreach encouraging them to book a call to explore how Partly can revolutionise their businesses.
  • Maintain an extremely healthy and clean pipeline. Obsess over each of our prospects to ensure deals are progressing and no opportunities are missed.
  • Optimise for revenue by negotiating large deals and upselling prospects with additional services and value-adds.
  • Help develop our Enterprise sales playbook with sales strategies, processes and tactics.
  • Communicate cross-teams to solve customer problems and relay customer feedback to the product team, engineers, and company executives.
  • Work closely with the product team to represent the voice of the customer and industry trends by gathering, summarising and sharing the most pressing issues facing our prospects and customers.
  • Identify ways to provide customers with the information and answers they need before they have to ask the questions.
  • Rapidly learn, grow and develop faster than the business, positioning yourself as a future leader at Partly.
 Your skills
  • Experience in Technology related Sales, Key Account Management or Business Development within a start-up or fast-growing company.
  • Experience with automotive businesses or knowledge of the parts industry
  • Demonstrated experience in Enterprise Selling, strategic execution in large multi-national accounts
  • Demonstrated experience engaging across all levels from C-level Executives to developers/architects.
  • Proven success managing time and juggling multiple accounts in a high-growth environment, while exceeding customer expectations
  • Business proficiency in the English language
  • (Bonus) Personal interest or passion for Cars or Motorsport
  • (Bonus) Experience in e-commerce and helping companies sell online
  • (Bonus) Part retailer or manufacturer rolodex
  • (Bonus) Experience working with a diverse range of geographies, cultures and linguistic backgrounds
 Benefits
  • Competitive base salary plus equity. Even though we're a small startup, we offer competitive salaries and great equity.
  • Generous parental leave and flexible return to work.
  • Flexible working hours and location. We have an office-first culture but you can work remotely or from home whenever it suits you. There are no fixed hours so you can choose to work when you're most effective.
  • Ergonomic office. Sit-stand desks, ergonomic chairs, quiet spaces, and collaboration spaces to suit all kinds of working styles.

results.title: Account Associate, Education
results.description:
Status: Full-time

Type: Exempt

Reports to: Senior Director of Education

ABOUT TECHCHANGE

Want to be part of a growing company that is using technology, pedagogy, and design to bring about positive social change? Founded in 2010, we are a social enterprise that works with leading nonprofits and government agencies worldwide to push the boundaries of what's possible in virtual learning and online events. From delivering an online series of courses on COVID response for frontline health workers to powering the world's largest human rights and tech conference (RightsCon), TechChange contributes to some of the most innovative and important conversations of our era.

TechChange provides human-powered services like facilitation, production, support, and design and a user-centric platform to support over 500K users across some 800 courses, workshops, and events. 

ROLE OVERVIEW

The Account Associate is an entry-level role for candidates interested in developing their client-facing, curriculum development, and virtual learning/collaboration tool belt. They work collaboratively and proactively with education team members to support the development and launch of beautiful and engaging learning experiences on topics that matter in a variety of formats such as courses, workshops, and learning events. In this role, you will support the creation of powerful learning experiences to achieve partner success in alignment with TechChange pedagogical best practices.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

On a typical day, Account Associates may work individually, or with a project team. A successful candidate will undertake the following duties and more as instructed by the Account Manager: 

  • Assist in the planning and implementation of projects
  • Help to coordinate and manage project tasks and deliverables, as assigned
  • Configure interactive learning experiences in native TechChange platform, informed by project design and client's needs
  • Support live learning events (moderating breakout discussions, supporting learnings of participants/clients) 
  • Analyze data as required
  • Recommend tools, activities, and design elements to improve students' overall experience
  • Liaise and coordinate deliverables with creative team and resources
  • Liaise with project stakeholders concerning project details and deliverables, as assigned
  • Act as a reliable team contributor by collaborating with colleagues on solution development and serving as a resource to Education team colleagues
  • Provide feedback into systems and processes that will improve role effectiveness contributing to inter-and-cross-team initiatives as needed
  • Develop and maintain knowledge and understanding of TechChange business and offerings
  • Perform other duties assigned by the Account Manager in an orderly and efficient manner
SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS
  • 1-3 years of workforce experience 
  • Highly organized and detail-oriented
  • Familiarity with teaching, education, and/or instructional design preferred
  • Ability to upskill quickly in new and evolving technical and SaaS software
  • Excellent interpersonal skills for collaborating effectively with others 
  • A self-starter who can multitask, work well under pressure, and work efficiently to meet strict deadlines while maintaining quality 
  • Ability to maintain understanding of project purpose and objectives
  • Poses an analytical and critical mindset for making the best decisions for successfully executing duties 
  • Competent public speaker and written/verbal communicator 
  • Highly coachable: takes feedback and appropriately applies at next available opportunity (Growth Mindset) 
  • Technical skills not required, a plus:
    • Virtual facilitation tools: Miro, Slido or Mentimeter, Zoom (or similar video conferencing tools) 
    • Project Management tools: Monday.com etc. 
  • Fluency in English required. Fluency in additional languages is highly valued
REMOTE/TIME ZONE CONSIDERATIONS

Remote (distributed, work-from-home structure); flexible east coast hours while serving global clients.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

The position will require extensive time sitting or standing and viewing computer screens from a home setup. The following capabilities may be required to perform this position's essential functions. Reasonable accommodations can be made available to address the following requirements.

  • May occasionally lift, carry, stoop, bend, etc. (no more than 20 pounds).
  • Ability to travel in the US and internationally (less than 10% time, when appropriate)
COMPENSATION

Salary range: $55,000 - $65,000 annually

BENEFITS
  • 3 weeks of paid time off 
  • 5-day winter shutdown
  • 10 company holidays
  • Parental leave 
  • Paid Sabbatical Leave
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision Plans
  • 401k, with company matching (eligible after 6 months)
  • Discretionary Profit Sharing Program
  • Professional development funding
  • Remote work 
APPLICATION DEADLINE 

Open until filled. 

EOE STATEMENT

TechChange is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. We know that our differences make us better. TechChange does not discriminate based on race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.

results.title: Sales Development Representative
results.description:
About Novata

Novata is a public benefit corporation created and funded by a unique consortium of foundations and private sector companies including the Ford Foundation, the Omidyar Network, S&P Global, and Hamilton Lane. We are a for-profit, mission-driven company with a goal of empowering the private markets to build a more inclusive and sustainable form of capitalism. By bringing together the brightest minds in financial data, private equity, social justice and inclusive capitalism, we aim to build the best technology and tools for the private markets to better collect, analyze, benchmark, and report ESG (Environmental, Social, Governance) data. We have an experienced and diverse team who are as ambitious about growing a successful company as we are about making an impact. We hope you’ll join us.

About the role

We’re looking for a results-driven sales development representative to actively seek new business opportunities, engage and build relationships with potential customers. You will provide complete and appropriate solutions for every potential customer to boost top-line revenue growth, customer acquisition levels, and profitability.

Requirements

Key Responsibilities

  • Qualify leads from marketing campaigns as sales opportunities
  • Contact potential prospects through cold calls and emails
  • Present our company to potential prospects
  • Identify prospect's needs and suggest appropriate products/services
  • Build long-term trusting relationships with prospects
  • Proactively seek new business opportunities in the market
  • Set up meetings or calls between (prospective) customers and Account Executives
  • Report to the Sales Manager on sales results

 

About you

 

The ideal candidate will have the following professional experience:

  • Proven work experience as a Sales Development Representative, Sales Account Executive, or similar role
  • SaaS/Tech based experience a plus
  • Comfortable in start-up/scale-up environment
  • Hands-on experience with multiple sales prospecting techniques like cold calling, cold emailing, and social outreach.
  • Track record of achieving sales quotas
  • Experience working with Hubspot

 

Work Style

  • Fair understanding of sales performance metrics
  • Excellent communication and negotiation skills
  • Ability to deliver engaging presentations
  • Quick on your feet
  • Positive, won’t quit attitude
  • Prospecting
  • Listening
  • Product Knowledge

Benefits

We want our employees to have the best opportunities at work and in life. We know that requires us to provide more than just a great place to work. We are committed to providing industry-leading benefits and flexibility that allow you to achieve all your life goals. Here are the important highlights:

  • Competitive salary reviewed annually to account for market shifts
  • Equity in the company (stock options)
  • Comprehensive health benefits packages (private medical, pension scheme)
  • Robust leave policies (PTO, parental leave, VTO)
  • Flexible work environment with full support for remote work and access to co-working space in London
  • Opportunities for personal and professional development
  • An experienced, mature, and extremely enthusiastic team that thrives on collaboration

 

Why Join Us?

Novata is a mission-first company built to enable the private markets to drive more impact. We are at the unique intersection of ESG, the private markets, and mission-driven impact. We are well-funded, have a top-tier executive leadership team, and have experienced a successful commercial launch in the first half of 2022. We have a highly aggressive growth plan to establish ourselves as the industry leader of ESG with immediate plans for product and international expansion.

Members of our leadership team have been globally recognized for their success as leaders of large public companies, founders of successful startups, leaders of established ESG organizations, and builders of robust tech platforms. We are passionate, highly motivated, and experienced individuals who embrace our diverse backgrounds. Together, we will become the platform of choice and a catalyst for a change in the way business is done.

Novata is an Equal Opportunity Employer and it is our policy that we will not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other protected category with respect to recruitment, hiring, training, promotion and other terms and conditions of employment.

results.title: Account Manager
results.description:
Account Manager

At Ireckonu, the Account Manager is an empowered position accountable for all elements of the client relationship. This role focuses on building strong partnerships with key account decision makers, resulting in positive outcomes and a high customer retention rate. You will also ensure that projects are delivered to scope, on-time and on-budget.

Account Managers must think both strategically and operationally, working to develop a deep understanding of the customer and their future needs while balancing the delivery of sold work. The Account Manager is responsible for planning, overseeing, and leading projects from ideation through to completion. You will leverage your in-depth knowledge of the customer to (jointly) formulate a growth-focused vision for your accounts, including an Account Plan.

The Account Manager role is key at Ireckonu and requires interaction with a range of internal and external stakeholders, most often managing several moving project parts simultaneously.

Account Responsibilities

  • Ability to understand the customer’s business goals and needs, and to translate them into product recommendations and strategic Account Plans.
  • Identify customer specific pain points or competitive disadvantages and capture new sales opportunities.
  • Implement & lead a consultative selling approach to strategically position Ireckonu’s value proposition.
  • Accurately and effectively document Account-related details & information, including ongoing updates to the CRM.
  • Contribute to internal product growth and roadmap discussions, using your in-depth customer knowledge to create added value for both the company and your accounts.
  • Communicate with the customer’s main points of contact to keep the project aligned with their goals – organize Quarterly Business Reviews.

Project Responsibilities

  • Assist in the definition, documentation and communication of project scope and goals.
  • Responsible for planning and overseeing projects to ensure that your customer’s projects are delivered to scope, in a timely fashion and within budget.
  • Create long and short-term plans, including setting targets for milestones, adhering to deadlines, and allocating resources.

  • Leverage an understanding of internal resources and capabilities to effectively delegate tasks to those best positioned to complete them.
  • Identify and manage risks, issues and dependencies from start to finish, and adjust schedules and targets on the project as needed.
  • Make effective and informed decisions when confronted with multiple options for how to progress with the project.
  • Ensure project teams remain cohesive and in synergy by facilitating consistent alignment and mitigating roadblocks before they become an issue.
  • Perform quality control tests throughout development to ensure client deliverables are to the highest standard and meet customer’s expectations.

Requirements

Hard skills:

  • Knowledge of various project management methodologies (e.g., agile/scrum)
  • Technical comprehension of APIs is an asset
  • Cost and risk management skills
  • Project planning & execution (incl. Jira usage & project plan creation)
  • Effective time management of yourself and others
  • Ability to create both internal and external alignment

Soft skills:

  • Ability to work in a fast-paced team environment
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal and prioritisation skills
  • Ability to communicate well with people on different levels and explain complicated technical concepts to technical and non-technical people
  • Ability to delegate effectively and make important decisions under pressure
  • Problem-solving skills
  • Friendly and approachable
  • Pro-active, sense of responsibility and demonstrated ability to work independently
  • Strong work ethic and positive team attitude
  • Fluency in English is required. Additional European languages are beneficial

Benefits

What Ireckonu Offers:

When you join Ireckonu, you will be working in a forward thinking, flat organization with a family-oriented support system. We organize and participate in sports events (cycling, running and soccer/futbal) and provide a daily healthy, “family” style lunch in our canteen. Our culture is one of an informal working atmosphere: come as you are, work hard, and support others. Beyond this we also offer:

  • Prime location – Our headquarters is in the historic Olympic Stadium in Amsterdam
  • Hybrid remote working
  • We can assist you in the VISA process if necessary

results.title: Senior Account Manager
results.description:
Senior Account Manager (Covering Welsh Region)

Who are you?

We are looking for an ambitious Account Manager to drive account growth and work closely with our client wing to deliver a best-in-class service each and every time!

Key responsibilities

  • Actively manage sales cycle for existing accounts; analyse and present data to your clients on a quarterly basis and support your clients with needs-based business cases.
  • Achieve and maintain high levels of satisfaction among senior stakeholder’s client side, achieving target scores from identified stakeholders.
  • Full contract management including renewals, change notices, risk mitigation and escalation, as well as involvement within bids and tenders
  • Provide internal forecasting reports on key customer commercial metrics
  • Understand what really matters to your stakeholders and the client, present benefits and value delivered to the Trust internally at Board and review meetings and via external comms
  • Work closely with sales and marketing team to generate leads into other Trusts, ICS, STP, and align strongly with our infamous transformation team to ensure we can deliver!

 

OK, that’s me, but who are DrDoctor?

DrDoctor is a HealthTech company on an exciting growth trajectory. Our technology focuses on engaging patients across their healthcare journey while saving hospitals time, effort, and money.

Our Mission is that healthcare needs a reset. More people need care every day and health services struggle. Current patient engagement is a mess of disparate systems that hinder, rather than help care delivery.

Our Vision is a remote-first healthcare system, which can meet demand without sacrificing care quality. We want patients to be engaged in their care, shifting to a digital first model.

We do this at scale:

  • 17 million+ patients use DrDoctor
  • We manage over 70 million appointments
  • We work with over 44 NHS Trusts and Health Boards (and still growing!)

We :green_heart: the NHS and want to help it work better. We radically transform the delivery of health services to make healthcare work for everyone – for patients, doctors, administrative teams and taxpayers.

OK, I’m interested. What experience do I need to have?

  • Demonstrable experience working with the NHS, ideally in a digital capacity.
  • Experience working as an Account Manager/Success Manager, focusing on account optimisation and upsell, with a track record in change management, project delivery or meeting sales targets
  • You know how to adapt your style to varying levels of people within the NHS
  • Have the ability to simplify a complex set of problems and structure the right solution for our clients - this may include project planning, technical understanding, benefits analysis etc.
  • You excel in a high growth, fast-paced, agile environment, and love getting the work done right
  • You are passionate about our mission 

We know from research and experience that candidates may not apply if they don’t think they meet 100% of our requirements. If you don’t tick all the boxes but feel you would be a good fit, we would still love to hear from you. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture!

Just to let you know too, we will need you to have the Right To Work in the UK, and as we work closely with the NHS, if we get to the stage where we make you an offer to join us, we will also need to undertake a DBS check.

We are perfect for each other, what are the next steps?

We are currently recruiting heavily and have a lot of CVs to go through. However, we don’t wait for roles to close before going through your CV. We will be in touch in a few days to let you know if we think we might be a match, and if we are not. Unfortunately, because we get so many CV’s we are not able to send an individual reply if it’s not a match. However, if you want more details as to why, just drop us a note and we will arrange to get some feedback over to you.

If it’s a match, then we will arrange a time to talk to you on a quick 30 minute call. It’s just an informal chat so you can relax! We will tell you more about the role, the team and why you should want to join us.

If we continue, then we will invite you in to meet the team and founders. Some our roles will also be subject to completing an assessment.

We get there are a lot of great roles out there, so we will make sure to get through the rounds as quickly as possible. All we ask is you keep us up to date with your plans.

I can’t wait to get started, what are the perks?

An awesome team? Ok, you want more?

  • Remote by default approach - Everyone at DrDoctor will work remotely most of the time with regular opportunities to socialise and engage at office spaces available in London and Manchester.
  • Flexible working (we understand we all have family and personal commitments; you can work where you are at your best and at times when you are most productive)
  • Part time working considered - let us know what you need and we’ll do our best to find the right balance for both parties
  • 25 days holiday plus Bank Holidays (with our own extra DrDoctor Bank Holidays thrown in for good measure!)
  • 4 duvet days per year for those days that you just don’t fancy working
  • Personal development time every other Friday, or for a whole day per month, differing based on which team you’re in
  • Mental health support through our partner OpenUp and our own in-house Mental Health First Aiders
  • Drinks/other fun things sent to you in the post
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • A new office space in Southwark including a Multipurpose quiet room which can be used for activities such as Prayer, Meditation, or caring for your baby
  • Enhanced parental leave (up to 16 weeks fully paid parental leave for anyone who brings a child into their home – whether this is via birth, adoption or surrogacy)
  • Salary competitive and dependant on experience, we benchmark our salaries to accurately reflect the market at least once a year, and we benchmark all of our roles (regardless of where in the UK you live) based on London salaries.
  • A focus on your career progression based on our progression framework, regular 6 months' pay reviews and mentoring opportunities
  • EMI share options scheme!

As DrDoctor has grown, we are seeing more of our people wanting to socialise in different ways.

Whilst we know that some of us love to go to the pub, we want to make sure we are including a wide variety of activities and events for our teams to enjoy each other's company, we aim to continue creating an open space for anyone and everyone to suggest how they’d like to spend time with their teams.

We love a Summer and Christmas party and regular company/team socials and away days. So far in 2022, we have enjoyed picnics at a nearby farm, a water colouring session, board games evening and Crystal Maze! We have also held various events for celebrations such as Eid ul-Fitr, Holi Festival, International Women’s Day and our 10 year anniversary!

Salary banding for this role is: £55,000 - £70,000 + Commission

results.title: Account Executive
results.description:
TuxCare is a Division of CloudLinux Inc., the maker of the #1 OS in security and stability for hosting providers. TuxCare provides a set of services to automate, simplify and enhance Linux security and operations for the Enterprise. It reduces the management tasks and patch delay risks with live patching, completely bypassing the need for complex service migration orchestration even when you have high availability in place.

The TuxCare Account Executive role is the front-line of revenue generation for the business. In this role you will be responsible for daily prospect engagement by finding leads, managing the sales cycle, negotiation, and closing deals. Supported by a team of Linux experts in presales, engineering and marketing, the Account Executive is the top driver of corporate growth.

For more details go to tuxcare.com.

As our Account Executive you will be responsible for:

  • Engage with new inbound leads daily
  • Navigate prospect organizations to present our value proposition to influencers, stakeholders, and decision-makers
  • Collaborating with key decision makers to identify opportunities and develop ideas that deliver sales results
  • Following up with prospects several times throughout the sales cycle to ensure needs are being met
  • Preparing and presenting proposals and bids
  • Negotiating terms and conditions with prospects
  • Manage a pipeline of opportunities in Hubspot and communicate regularly on progress and status
  • Identify opportunities for prospects to act as public TuxCare advocates (e.g. testimonials, case studies)
  • Collaborate closely with company leadership to identify expansion opportunities
  • Work with SEs, CSM and Account Manager to ensure successful new customer adoption and onboarding
  • Staying current on company offerings and industry trends

Requirements

To be successful in this role you should have:

  • 5+ years in Business Development or Enterprise Sales
  • A successful track record showing a high close rate and expedited sales cycles
  • Knowledge of Linux infrastructure and/or security software
  • Exceptional communication skills, highly organized, collaborative and detail-oriented
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize appropriately across multiple concurrent engagements
  • Experience building and maintaining relationships, while working to mitigate risk and drive successful deal closure
  • Experience working with Hubspot is a plus

Benefits

What's in it for you?

  • A focus on professional development;
    • Training reimbursements
    • Mentor programs
    • Knowledge-Exchange programs
    • Interesting and challenging projects
  • Flexible working hours
  • Paid 24 days of vacation per year and unlimited sick leave
  • Medical insurance reimbursement
  • Co-working and gym/sports reimbursement
  • The opportunity to receive a reward for the most innovative idea that the company can patent.

By applying for this position, you agree with Cloudlinux Privacy Policy and give us your consent to maintain and process your personal data with this respect. Please read our Privacy Policy for more information.

results.title: Strategic Account Manager
results.description:
FormAssembly is growing fast and we are excited to add a Strategic Account Manager to focus on our top strategic customers in select sectors. You will be working on expansion business within territory based on Named Accounts. This is a full-time position, open to all locations (working remotely from home)

Responsibilities:

  • Selling FormAssembly licenses, support and services across a predominantly existing strategic customer list.
  • Increasing revenue spend within a list of strategic global companies
  • Having a deep understanding of the way businesses operate, how private and public companies make decisions, and the priorities that drive decisions from the C-level.
  • Building account strategy and territory plans
  • Building credibility and trust while influencing buying decisions.
  • Uncovering executive-level initiatives and pain points to map back our solutions across multiple lines of business.
  • Selling on value.
  • Partnering with internal resources in order to drive additional value and expertise.
  • Generating pipeline that leads to closed revenue and quota attainment.
  • Accurately forecasting.

Requirements

  • 3+ years of YoY account growth, 5+ years of full cycle sales experience
  • Experience managing a maximum of 20-30 accounts, majority existing customers
  • Consistent annual quota attainment of at least $500,000 in ARR
  • Experience selling to the C-suite (all LOB)
  • Experience in comprehending and delivering compelling value propositions.
  • Ability to manage extended teams consisting of solution engineers, customer success, implementation services, sales development resources.

Bonus Points for:

  • Experience working remote
  • Bachelor's degree



Benefits

FormAssembly offers several benefits that help to facilitate a healthy team, personal growth, and a work-life balance, all of which contribute to creating a more engaged and passionate workforce.

  • Health benefits (health, dental, vision) for team members based in the United States
  • 401(k) with 4% company match for team members based in the United States
  • Unlimited paid vacation and 9 company holidays
  • Flexible work schedule
  • Paid parental leave
  • Charitable contribution match
  • Budget for professional development
  • Company provided Mac laptop

You'll be joining a talented and fun team, working together to build something great!

results.title: Sales Development Representative
results.description:
FormAssembly is growing, we're not slowing down, and we're aiming high in 2023! We are looking for experienced and previously successful SDRs to join our team and make an immediate impact on the pipeline. The most successful candidates for this role are proactive and continuous learners who want to level up their skill set, add value to an amazing company and SDR team, and have aspirations for a long-term sales career.

As a Sales Development Representative with FormAssembly, you will be provided with some inbound leads, however, there will be a focus on generating some of our own pipeline with a strategic and thoughtful outbound motion. Our primary goal is to schedule high-quality meetings for our Account Executive team to close and drive revenue for the growing organization.

Responsibilities:

  • Schedule qualified meetings for our Account Executive team, from marketing-generated, inbound leads, as well as from strategic and outbound prospecting efforts.
  • Prospect and develop leads with phone calls, email cadences, LinkedIn outreach, and other resourceful “smart selling” lead generation practices.
  • Perform pre-call prospect research on leads and contacts.
  • Learn prospects’ current challenges and desired future state to offer a solution.
  • Proactively provide feedback to the manager and other teams with the goal of continuous improvement for all.
  • Actively collaborate cross-departmentally with a growth mindset and an eye on the big picture.
  • Maintain proper CRM data integrity and hygiene.

Requirements

  • 3-6+ months of previous SDR experience demonstrating success in the role.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Proactively focused on continuous and perpetual improvement in your craft.
  • Coachable and hungry to learn.
  • Strong organizational and time management skills.
  • Proficient in using and learning new technology and systems.
  • Preferably located in a U.S Eastern/Central time zone, or be able to work standard U.S. Eastern hours daily
 
Bonus Points
  • Sales Experience.
  • SaaS Experience.
  • Salesforce Experience.
  • Remote work Experience.

About Us:

FormAssembly is a 100% remote SaaS company dedicated to helping customers streamline organizational processes and be better stewards of their data and we are looking for key individuals to join our rapidly growing team.

Customers like Amazon, PayPal, New York City, Harvard, and thousands of other organizations worldwide rely on FormAssembly to capture the data they need quickly and securely. We have been recognized in the 2020 Inc. 5000 list of fastest-growing private companies, and we are a G2 Crowd Winter 2021 Leader.

We're intelligent, adaptive, and growing rapidly - thanks to our impressive roster of customers.

Here are some links to give you a peek into what it's like to work at FormAssembly:

Meet our awesome team.

Learn how and why we work remotely.

If you’re a genuinely nice person who is great to work with, respectful, and who will put the team and our customers first, we’d be thrilled to have you apply for this position. FormAssembly is an equal-opportunity employer. If you belong to an under-represented group in tech, you’ll find a welcoming culture that thrives on diversity.

This is a full-time position, open to all locations (working remotely from home)

results.title: Head of Sales
results.description:
Legl is a fast-growing, vertical B2B SaaS platform with a mission to bring the legal industry into the 21st century. We just closed our $18M Series B (May 2022), and we are scaling quickly on our next phase of growth.

Our vision is to be part of a structural change in the legal industry so that firms, as well as their clients, have a better experience of accessing legal services. We launched in October 2019 and in the short time since then have acquired over 170+ law firm clients.

We have an agile, ambitious and collaborative team, deep experience across design, tech and the industry, and we put our employees first. We’re looking for people who can grow with us.

Our core values are agility, ambition, and collaboration. We rely heavily on data and first principles decision-making.

The Role:

We’re hiring a leader to own our Sales strategy and execution. Ultimately responsible for logo acquisition numbers and the overall performance of the sales team, our Head of Sales will drive revenue and empower our team. Maintaining a keen focus on building a scalable, repeatable sales process, you will lead on forecasting and reporting alongside hiring and team training.

This is a key role, reporting into SVP Revenue and Commercial Strategy, and will work closely with our Customer Success, Marketing and GTM teams. The Sales team currently comprises AEs and SDRs and we have a RevOps Manager who acts as a strategic partner supporting you across improving processes, consistent reporting and CRM management.

As we continue our expansion, we foresee significant growth opportunities for our Head of Sales as the business considers other verticals, geos and market segments (e.g. enterprise); as well as reviewing how we can better manage cross-sell and up-sell opportunities.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Working with marketing and sales ops to ensure we have a solid lead generation pipeline and outbound lead process, and leads are allocated effectively
  • Ensuring the right-sized and shaped Sales team, from hiring to team composition (SDRs and AEs) so that we can deliver on short-term and medium term financial goals
  • Hiring, onboarding and training the Sales team whilst setting targets, incentives and rewards to drive success
  • Line managing AEs and SDRs – and performance managing those teams towards achieving targets
  • Building a scalable, repeatable process; iterating on that process and identifying improvements to funnel conversion rates
  • Building and enhancing pipeline management, forecasting and managing deals at risk
  • Forecasting and reporting to the exec team (and the board) with a particular focus on strategy and highlighting any trends or challanges
  • Collaborate with Product to advocate for changes that will have a positive impact on sales outcomes
  • Working alongside Customer Success leadership to ensure a proper handover process is in place

Requirements

  • Proven experience in B2B sales with significant recent exposure to a sales leadership role
  • Experience in LegalTech or selling software solutions into law firms is essential
  • Proven track record of over achieving against sales targets and securing sales within new customer accounts
  • Strong leadership skills, bringing the ability to grow and motivate a high-performance-driven team
  • Naturally analytical with a passion for using data ad metrics to validate assumptions, recommendations and drive actions
  • Consultative approach to sales with exceptional relationship-building skills
  • Comfortable with high levels of autonomy and accountability
  • Thrives a very fast-paced, scale-up environment
  • Experience in managing, recruiting and leading teams in a fast paced environment
  • Strong business acumen and problem-solving skills

Benefits

  • Competitive salary and share options: we all share in Legl’s success
  • Legl has a dynamic, remote-first culture, with a focus on making work work for you. We give generous budgets for home set-ups, co-working space use if you need or want it and access to office spaces for collaboration in person, no matter where you live.
  • Opportunity to join a well-funded, post-Series B startup in our mission to make legal services better for everyone
  • High impact work that really matters - success in this role will drive our growth and have a big impact on the business and our clients
  • A focus on wellbeing with access to support sessions with a psychotherapist and a personal wellbeing budget of £250 per year
  • A learning and development budget of £1000 per year
  • Regular company socials with bi-annual offsites, where we all get together in-person, as well as frequent remote social events

Diversity

We believe that having diverse teams in which everyone can be their authentic self is key to our success. We encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds to apply.

results.title: Account Executive
results.description:
About Magic

Magic is a frictionless way to identify thoroughly vetted, cost-effective remote workers, to help scale your key business functions. Through a combination of automation and active work, Magic taps into its network of vetted remote workers who handle tasks from virtual assistance and customer service to sales lead generation and scheduling across various team members—like magic. Magic sources, screens, and hire assistants so you don’t have to. Since 2015, the company has sourced and screened over 10,000 assistants.

  • TL;DR: Forget the job boards, or marketplaces, and let us handle the vetting process so you’ll only interact with the best, and most reliable remote workers, every time.

Background

Our company came out of Y Combinator in 2015. Since then we've grown to 1000+ remote workers, with strong venture-backing (including Sequoia Capital) and over $30M in funding to date. We are fully remote across Asia and US time zones.

Magic's Business Profile

Magic's Careers Page

 

 

Why does this role exist

We are looking for an Account Executive who will be responsible for the client relationship that has multiple assistants with the Magic Dedicated product. This role is responsible for understanding the client’s core want, capturing the client's business pain points, and building trust and product knowledge with the client. They are to ensure we are moving fast and efficiently to exceed their expectations and allow them to grow with Magic through engagement.

He/She will be the internal advocate for our high-priority Magic Dedicated clients assigned to them and ensures client needs are met while understanding the overall client lifecycle and the abilities of the Dedicated teams. They will work closely with other Magic Dedicated team members and communicate directly with the clients, or company points of contact, over the phone and email. The main objective is to address client needs, understand the capacity of their current assistants, and know how else the Dedicated product can supplement their company needs.

 

The impact that you'll make...

  • Communicate effectively with both internal and external senior-level management and stakeholders.
  • Define and understand client needs to ensure a successful relationship from start to finish.
    • High touch account ownership.
    • Solving problems with a never say no attitude.
  • Handle the onboarding process for the client to better understand their needs, their specific KPIs, and the deliverables they’re looking for Magic.
  • Handle any of the client escalations while taking actions for resolution and client satisfaction
  • Handle frequent email, phone, and messaging check-ins and feedback
  • Being the client advocate inside the company to ensure high retention and growth from the business. Proactively offering solutions before being told
  • Doing continual research to stay knowledgeable about the client’s business and growth needs
  • Handle client-specific communication on product questions, billing, future needs, etc.
  • Solve problems by coming up with concrete actions that lead to fast, meaningful solutions.
  • Maintain account records and thorough documentation of the client interactions and lifecycle of their business
  • Meet or exceed company revenue, retention, and growth goals
  • Flexible and understanding of an ever-changing environment
  • Collaborate and execute projects to drive client satisfaction, retention, and Personal growth

Requirements

  • Has at least 3 to 5 years of proven work experience in account management and client relationship management for B2B US-based accounts/businesses. Preferably has a background in RPO, Recruitment & Staffing, or BPO industries.
  • Has proven knowledge and experience in US-based client retention, loyalty, and contract renewals.
  • Experience using HubSpot and Notion is a plus, but not required.
  • Must be fluent in English, both written and oral.
  • Willing to have a flexible schedule between 10 pm - 10 am PHT.
  • Education required: Bachelor's Degree in any course

Your superpowers are…

  • Strong communication skills: Proficient in verbal English. Must have strong skills on the phone, be confident, friendly, and business savvy.
  • Ability to understand clients’ core want and their business needs - more of building a friendship and not closing a sale.
  • Very dynamic team player and works well with other departments.
  • Communicates and collaborates well with others.
  • Can set clear expectations and is organized.

 

You should apply if...

  • You are highly motivated, possess a growth mindset and grit, and are a self-starter who is professional, positive, and not afraid of challenging work.
  • You are passionate about communicating with purpose, sharing with context, and considering the audiences of the messages - how the receivers might perceive it and aware of the impact it will bring.
  • You have a dynamic personality with a drive to reach decision-makers.
  • You are highly reliable with a GSD mindset despite external circumstances. You say what you mean and do what you say. You are consistent and take ownership in situations, large or small.
  • You are experienced in HubSpot and other similar prospecting applications.
  • You are Proactive, see potential problems before they happen, and aren’t afraid to speak up/challenge the status quo.
  • You have a strong work ethic and possess a can-do attitude when faced with challenges
  • You thrive in a remote work environment. Fully remote work is not for everyone; it requires the ability to quickly pick up online tools, get familiar with our tech stack (G-Drive, Slack, etc.), and communicate (and often over-communicate) well in writing.
  • You love learning new things. Whether you learn best through reading, listening, doing, or exploring, you’re perpetually curious about the world and work around you and always trying to level up your personal and professional life through self-directed learning.

Benefits

Why Join Us?

results.title: Account Executive
results.description:
Have you wondered whether it’s possible to find gratifying work in a fast-paced startup that is also mission focused?

Join EarlyBird Education where we are leveraging cutting-edge brain science, artificial intelligence and gamification to prevent reading struggles. Children play a game and we can identify whether they are at risk for reading difficulties, like dyslexia - even before they learn to read - and in the window when intervention re-wires the brain for reading success. With a mission to scale this to all children nationwide, EarlyBird is already in use in schools across the country with thousands of children. Join this fast growing, venture-funded team as we provide essential data, tools and resources to support educators, parents and pediatricians to change the learning trajectory of children nationwide.

As an Account Executive, and critical early employee of this startup company, you will play a major role in scaling this next-generation education technology. We’ll look to you to do what you do best; to bring fresh ideas to the table that can make our products, our work and our team better. This is your opportunity to play a key role in a company that is transforming the way young children learn.

Responsibilities

  • Qualify inbound leads and convert those leads into new partnerships
  • Craft and execute outbound strategy in partnership with EarlyBird’s instructional experts, and key opinion leaders in specific markets
  • Optimize sales process with Marketing, Sales Leader and Customer Success
  • Update CRM with learnings and pipeline projections

Skills and Experience

  • 1-4 years experience as a quota-carrying sales representative and/or sales closer experience in K-12 education (preferably SaaS and/or assessment)
  • Deep understanding of early literacy curriculum, instruction, and assessment as it pertains to the Science of Reading.
  • Ability to connect and build trust with school and district decision-makers
  • Ability to navigate complex early literacy conversations with enthusiasm, substance and nuance
  • Self-motivated with ability to work in fast paced, changing environment

What you will get out of this role

  • The chance to connect with educators around a really challenging, complex, and critical instructional problem in schools by scaling the reach of EarlyBird to tens of thousands of students.
  • A chance to build the growth engine of a research-driven education company from the ground up without compromising integrity, ambition, or fun.
  • A direct line to the product development team to share feedback from the field in order to make EarlyBird the strongest PreK-3 literacy platform in the market.
  • Become knowledgeable in early literacy instruction and dyslexia screening from some of the world’s foremost experts.
  • Contribute meaningfully to the culture of an inclusive, dynamic, and substantive growth team at a mission-driven education technology company.
  • Leadership opportunities to drive innovative approaches to pipeline development and positioning in the K-12 market.

Culture - We are building a team that brings a joyful urgency to this serious and critical work. We are science-driven and crave feedback. We assume best intentions and look for opportunities to lift our teammates up. We are transparent and humble with our customers while also being proud of the value and service we can provide them. Below are a few of the beliefs that we hold as a team and the type of person we think will do well on our team:

Beliefs

  • All children are capable of learning at a high level
  • Every child deserves access to evidence-based literacy instruction tailored to their needs
  • Educators deserve comprehensive literacy assessment data that is accessible and actionable.
  • Schools and districts need instructional and technology partners that build the tools and provide the support that are targeted and responsive to their feedback.
  • We have the team, technology, and focus to meaningfully change the trajectory of millions of children’s lives.

Professional Traits

  • Organized and strong time management skills
  • Excellent writer; you enjoy crafting a message for a particular person and then revising that message over time as you look at the effectiveness of your initial attempt.
  • Self-aware and persuasive communicator; you make space for others to share their passion and expertise while knowing when you can contribute most to individual and group conversations.
  • A thirst for knowledge and growth in a mission-driven start-up; your skills and ambition could take you anywhere, but you are motivated each day by the fact that our solution helps teachers empower and liberate students from reading difficulties.
  • A sense of urgency and persistence; the window for intervention for millions of kids is now and you are driven to meet that moment for those children.
  • Flexible; we're a small company that moves and reacts fast when there is sufficient data and evidence to justify a change in direction.

Benefits

Benefits

  • Critical early member of a startup team
  • Competitive Compensation
  • Fun & Flexible Team
  • Unlimited vacation and flexible work hours
  • Excellent health and dental insurance
  • Paid parental leave
  • Home Office Setup Stipend
  • Remote team, with regular company gatherings

results.title: Enterprise Account Executive, Biopharma
results.description:
Ganymede is building AWS for the sciences, with a mission of improving the world through better healthcare outcomes. Our platform is the most powerful way to integrate lab instruments, apps, and databases together in a single data lake, and drive automation between them.

As Ganymede's most senior salesperson in the biopharma vertical, you'll play an integral role closing the largest accounts as well as developing overall sales strategy for the commercial team as a whole. You'll sell highly complex cloud software products in complex and long enterprise sales processes, but will achieve large sales numbers and commissions in return. The entire Ganymede team will be ready to support your success, from engineering, to marketing, to the founders who you'll work very directly on a daily basis with to close sales.

Our Principles

  • Improving lives through better medicine: we’re intensely mission-focused, and are building a highly scalable business to make an impact on society.
  • Kindness: we come from a future where all human beings are treated with dignity, inclusivity, and active empathy, so we apply that to ourselves first in how we hire and treat each other.
  • Transparency: we are one team, and hold that openness is foundational to ensuring fairness, and that our actions tie to our shared mission.
  • Accountability: we believe that trust is the basis for building anything substantial, and stems from our being accountable to ourselves and each other.

Requirements

What we look for:

  • 6+ years of experience in enterprise software sales to biotechs, pharma, or manufacturing (ideally SaaS)
  • Deep relationships with multiple high-potential accounts
  • Successful track record of closing 6-7 figure ARR deals and hitting or exceeding quotas in an enterprise sales role
  • Ability to cultivate deep relationships with clients and develop strategic attack plans for key accounts
  • Mentorship of junior colleagues and team-members to grow overall team and department sales
  • Desire to improve software to accelerate medicine

Benefits

  • Highly competitive salary and equity as an early employee, along with industry-leading sales commissions
  • Remote-first role and culture, with periodic reimbursed travel for the team to meet together.
  • Unlimited PTO & sick days
  • Excellent health benefits (Medical, Dental & Vision), life, and disability insurance
  • Family leave (Maternity, Paternity, Medical, Caregiver)

Compensation Range
  • 150K-220K base, 400K+ OTE

results.title: Sales Executive - Jumbo Employers
results.description:
Be a part of the team building the future of healthcare!

Firefly Health is building a revolutionary new type of comprehensive health "care and coverage” plan, powered by a relationship-driven care team, a trusted virtual and in-person clinical network, and our proprietary technology platform.

Founded by experienced clinicians and technology leaders, Firefly Health is on a mission to deliver half-priced health care that's twice as good, clinically and emotionally. We are flipping the script on what it means to be a health plan and actually providing a true health benefit to members.

We are intensely focused on optimizing the physical + mental + financial wellbeing of those who want (and deserve) something better than the status quo. If you are ready to roll up your sleeves and take on our audacious mission, then we would love to hear from you.

Your Role

This Sales Executive position will be responsible for building upon our emerging jumbo employer vertical. In this role, you will be accountable for health plan sales to employers with more than 25,000 employees. As a natural storyteller and teacher, you will paint a compelling picture of our self-funded health plan solution and how it’s the long-term, sustainable solution that will support our customer’s business objectives.

You will:

  • Drive new sales with jumbo employers by developing strategies that drive top of funnel activity and efficiently move prospects to a win
  • Educate and shape the views of brokers, consultants, and employers to enhance Firefly’s place as a disruptive market leader, challenging the status quo
  • Work cross-functionally with internal teams, including Marketing, Product Development, Network Development, etc., to ensure client success and performance
  • Maintain and update employer opportunities and track sales activity metrics in our Salesforce CRM

You’d be a good fit if:

  • At least 10+ years of experience selling health plans to jumbo employers
  • Established relationships with jumbo employers and employee health benefits consultants that have a national presence
  • Deep familiarity with the process by which jumbo employers purchase a health plan for their employees (e.g., timeline, decision-making criteria, etc.)
  • Strong experience and focus selling and closing new business vs. retention of existing book of business
  • Experience championing the deal internally, coordinating resources across marketing, product, implementation and leadership
  • Strong track record of consistently meeting / exceeding large yearly quotas in the jumbo employer segment
  • Knowledge of Salesforce CRM
  • Active accident and health insurance broker license required or willingness to obtain it within 90 days from the date of hire



Our office is located in Watertown, Massachusetts but we’ve developed a robust remote working structure to give us more flexibility geographically while hiring for many positions.

This role can be done largely remotely, there are several times a year when staff come together onsite for planning and team building..

We are always looking for valuable talent to add to our growing team. Even if you’re not sure this role is the one for you, don’t let that stop you. We’d love to have a conversation to see where you could fit.

Firefly is an equal opportunity employer. We value diverse backgrounds and perspectives. We're committed to building and sustaining an inclusive workplace culture where individuals are treated with dignity and respect. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

results.title: Sales Operations Lead
results.description:
Stacker is seeking a Sales Operations Lead who will work closely with revenue leadership in our Studio organization to support sales operations needs. This individual will provide leaders with data analysis to provide insight into performance against goals, support timely decisions, and solve sales and operational challenges to drive more revenue for the business. This role requires a business-oriented mindset coupled with a technical acumen and an analytical prowess to understand and execute a wide-range of tasks and projects to make our go to market teams successful.


The Company

Stacker is a new media company excited by the future of journalism. Every day, our efforts center on developing new and more sustainable ways to produce, distribute, and fund great storytelling that contextualizes our world and drives impact for news publishers big and small. We do this through a number of ways—from our tech-forward storytelling method and freely accessible newswire, to offering a structured avenue for non-publisher organizations to participate and contribute to quality journalism.

Our ultimate mission is to empower the world’s publishers: through a commitment to provide free access to great storytelling and by championing innovation in how journalism is done, we enable our national- and local-scale publishing partners to engage their audiences and focus on their own original reporting.

As a bootstrapped company, we’re a resourceful team focused on building an inclusive, equitable culture around shared values of integrity, ownership, and collaboration. Building for the future is reflected in the way we work: we are remote-first, embrace flexible schedules, and offer competitive benefits and perks including unlimited vacation, an employee equity program, heath & dental coverage, and 401(k) matching.

We’re always looking for curious, media-minded thinkers to join the team. We encourage women, people of color, veterans, people with disabilities and gender nonconforming candidates to apply.

Responsibilities
  • Collaborate with Studio leaders on strategic initiatives that increase sales productivity, operational efficiency, and revenue. Perform analyses on trends and performance to identify opportunities for improvement, recommend new growth drivers, and address scaling challenges. Scope, prioritize and drive a variety of projects to completion, including team training and documentation.
  • Develop and refine sales processes, systems, policies, and procedures. Assist and revamp a host of go-to-market parts, such as ideal customer profile categorizations, lead routing, pricing and packaging, pipeline tracking and account ownership.
  • Be the expert for the sales and renewal performance, forecasting and pipeline health, communicating timely analysis and insight to ensure leadership has a pulse on the business.
  • Consult with team leads to define performance metrics, tracking, analyzing and reporting on them on an ongoing basis. Build sales dashboards and run ad hoc data analysis as needed.
  • Manage the CRM and an evolving sales enablement technology stack, making enhancements to streamline processes and troubleshoot operational issues as they surface. Engage with the team to consistently obtain feedback to improve performance and drive adoption.
  • Gather sales requirements and prioritize needs to identify new tools. Facilitate discussions with vendors, create recommendations, manage onboarding through rollout and conduct training.
  • Manage CRM data integrity, performing data quality checks, importing data and running clean-up projects to improve the quality and accuracy of information to ensure the team is able to make key business decisions with confidence.
  • Assist in driving strategic planning efforts across the Studio organization, including aligning leaders on OKRs and KPIs, forecasts, and headcount plans.
  • Help establish sales/account management compensation program policies and procedures and run commission calculations. Be a thought partner in proposing new incentive designs including temporary incentives to support short term goals.
  • Create and maintain documentation on processes, guides, best practices, sales playbooks.

Assist with the onboarding and development of Studio team members, including creating and improving documentation related to systems how-tos, sales trainings, and Studio terminology.

Requirements

  • 3-5 years of experience in Sales Operations, Business Operations, Revenue Operations, Consulting, Strategy, Analytics or similar roles ideally within Tech, Media or other high-growth, fast paced environments
  • Robust experience organizing, analyzing and reporting on data. Experience creating dashboards in business intelligence tools such as Google Data Studio and Tableau is a plus.
  • Ability to track and analyze go-to-market metrics (such as CAC, LTV, Churn, etc.) and extract business insights to turn them into actionable strategies
  • Advanced proficiency analyzing data in Google Sheets / Excel using complex formulas, pivot tables, and data filters/sorts.
  • Previous experience with CRM systems (i.e. Hubspot, Salesforce) as a power user including creating reporting, managing records, cleaning duplicates, troubleshooting issues and making improvements. Experience administering Hubspot is a plus.
  • Working knowledge and/or experience navigating sales enablement, lead gen and marketing systems and tools (i.e. SalesLoft, Outreach, ZoomInfo, Mailchimp, MixMax, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, etc.)
  • Sales planning & strategy experience, including forecasting, setting goals, and measuring performance against quotas
  • A basic understanding of sales compensation methodologies
  • Experience with documenting and capturing processes, to-dos, and trainings
  • Highly motivated, willing to learn new technologies and able to work both independently & cross-functionally to drive projects through to completion
  • Organized with excellent prioritization skills to navigate a fast-moving, changing environment
  • Demonstrated attention to detail and ability to shift from strategic to detail-oriented initiatives
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills

Benefits

Employee wellbeing is top of mind for the Stacker team. We offer the following benefits to all team members:

  • Competitive Base
  • Equity Stock Option Program
  • Full Health & Dental Coverage
  • Fully Remote Team
  • Unlimited PTO
  • 401k Matching
  • 3 Months of Paid Family Leave
  • Weekly *Treat Yourself* Stipend
  • Continuous learning curriculum
  • Annual Team Offsites
  • Monthly Virtual Social Events
  • Awesome & Inclusive team culture!

Stacker is dedicated to creating a diverse and inclusive newsroom that reflects the communities we serve. We encourage women, people of color, veterans, people with disabilities and gender nonconforming candidates to apply.

Stacker is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.
